title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
8-9:

  • Contains a clear, well-developed thesis that addresses how and why relations between the

  • United States and American Indian nations changed between 1830 and 1900.

  • Develops the thesis with substantial and relevant historical information.

  • Provides effective analysis of how and why relations between the United States and American

  • Indian nations changed between 1830 and 1900; treatment of multiple parts may be somewhat uneven.

  • May contain minor errors that do not detract from the quality of the answer.

  • Is well organized and well written.

5-7:

  • Contains a partially developed thesis that addresses how and why relations between the

  • United States and American Indian nations changed between 1830 and 1900.

  • Supports the thesis with some relevant historical information.

  • Provides some analysis of how and why relations between the United States and American Indian nations changed between 1830 and 1900, but treatment of multiple parts may be uneven.

  • May contain errors that do not seriously detract from the quality of the essay.

  • Has acceptable organization and writing.

2-4:

  • Contains an unfocused or limited thesis, or simply paraphrases the question.

  • Provides minimal relevant information, or lists facts with little or no application to the question.

  • May address the question only partially, with limited or no analysis.

  • May have major errors.

  • May be poorly organized and/or written.

0-1:

  • Lacks a thesis or simply repeats the question.

  • Demonstrates an irrelevant or inappropriate response.

  • Has numerous errors.

  • Is organized and/or written so poorly that it inhibits understanding.

The “—” Essay:

  • Is blank
